sourceText: Teach your child about keeping safe distances
text: Teach your child about keeping safe distances

sourceText: Create a flexible but consistent daily routine.
text: Create a flexible but consistent daily routine.

sourceText: Make a schedule for you and your children that has time for structured activities as well as free time. This can help children feel more secure and better behaved.
text: Make a schedule for you and your children that has time for structured activities as well as free time. This can help children feel more secure and better behaved.

sourceText: Children or teenagers can help plan the routine for the day – like making a school timetable. Children will follow this better if they help to make it.
text: Children or teenagers can help plan the routine for the day – like making a school timetable. Children will follow this better if they help to make it.

sourceText: Include exercise in each day - this helps with stress and kids with lots of energy at home.
text: Include exercise in each day - this helps with stress and kids with lots of energy at home.

sourceText: You are a model for your child’s behavior.
text: You are a model for your child’s behavior.

sourceText: If you practice keeping safe distances and hygiene yourself, and treat others with compassion, especially those who are sick or vulnerable – your children and teenagers will learn from you.
text: If you practice keeping safe distances and hygiene yourself, and treat others with compassion, especially those who are sick or vulnerable – your children and teenagers will learn from you.

sourceText: At the end of each day, take a minute to think about the day. Tell your child about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: At the end of each day, take a minute to think about the day. Tell your child about one positive or fun thing they did.

sourceText: Praise yourself for what you did well today.
text: Praise yourself for what you did well today.

sourceText: You are a star!
text: You are a star!

sourceText: If it is OK in your country, get children outside.
text: If it is OK in your country, get children outside.

sourceText: You can also write letters and draw pictures to share with people.
text: You can also write letters and draw pictures to share with people.

sourceText: Put them up outside your home for others to see!
text: Put them up outside your home for others to see!

sourceText: You can reassure your child by talking about how you are keeping safe.
text: You can reassure your child by talking about how you are keeping safe.

sourceText: Listen to their suggestions and take them seriously.
text: Listen to their suggestions and take them seriously.

sourceText: Make handwashing and hygiene fun
text: Make handwashing and hygiene fun

sourceText: Make a 20-second song for washing hands. Add actions!
text: Make a 20-second song for washing hands. Add actions!

sourceText: Give children points and praise for regular handwashing.
text: Give children points and praise for regular handwashing.

sourceText: Make a game to see how few times we can touch our faces with a reward for the least number of touches (you can count for each other).
text: Make a game to see how few times we can touch our faces with a reward for the least number of touches (you can count for each other).

sourceText: Structure Up
text: Structure Up

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Covid-19 Parenting

sourceText: COVID-19 has interrupted our daily work, home and school routines.
text: COVID-19 has interrupted our daily work, home and school routines.

sourceText: This is hard for children, teenagers and for you. Making new routines can help.
text: This is hard for children, teenagers and for you. Making new routines can help.

Research on Parenting for Lifelong Health is supported by the UKRI GCRF Accelerate Hub, the Oak Foundation, the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Seventh Framework Programme and the Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme, the Global Alliance for Chronic Diseases under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation Programme, UNICEF, WHO, Oxford University Innovation GCRF Sustainable Impact Fund, the Leverhulme Trust, the Economic and Social Research Council, CIDA, the National Research Foundation of South Africa, Ilifa Labantwana, the John Fell Fund, the Evaluation Fund, the UBS Optimus Foundation, USAID-PEPFAR, the Wellcome Trust, Grand Challenges Canada and Wellspring Advisors.
